item.title: Hulk Hogan, Pro Wrestler Who Became a Household Name, Dies at 71
item.description: Fueled by Hulkamania, he played good guys and bad in the ring, starred in movies and had his own reality show and Saturday morning cartoon.

item.title: Michael Ochs, Pop Culture’s Preeminent Photo Archivist, Dies at 82
item.description: The self-described “music junkie” collected millions of images of singers, actors and celebrities for an archive that fed CD reissues, books, news sites and documentaries.

item.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter’s Stepson Shoots and Kills His 13-Year-Old Son in “Incomprehensible Tragic Accident”
item.description: Duane “Dog” Chapman’s stepson Gregory Zecca, who is the son of Chapman’s wife, Francie, reportedly shot his son Anthony on Saturday in Florida.

item.title: Kate Beckinsale Announces Death of Her Mother, British Actress Judy Loe, at 78: “I Am Paralyzed”
item.description: Loe, best known for her TV work on shows like ‘General Hospital,’ ‘Inspector Morse,’ ‘Casualty’ and ‘Holby City,’ died on July 15 following a stage four cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Joanna Bacon, British Actress Known for ‘Love Actually’ and ‘Breeders,’ Dies at 72
item.description: Bacon’s death was confirmed by the Harlow Theatre Company this week, who said she passed away on June 14 following a battle with cancer.

item.description: David Gergen, a former political analyst and consultant to four American presidents, has died. He was 83. His son, Christopher, confirmed to the New York Times that Gergen died of Lewy body dementia i
